title: Syria Live Updates: Rebels Assert Control in Damascus as Questions Loom Over Their Plans
content: The fighters who forced Bashar al-Assad into exile began the complex task of governing the Syrian capital. New York Times reporters entering the country saw relics of the deposed regime on the highway from Lebanon.
summary: The fighters who forced Bashar al-Assad into exile began the complex task of governing the Syrian capital. New York Times reporters entering the country saw relics of the deposed regime on the highway from Lebanon.

title: Revolutions Swept the Middle East in 2011. Will Syria’s End Differently?
content: Bashar al-Assad’s downfall evokes memories of uprisings in Egypt, Libya, Tunisia and Yemen, each of which brought civil war or authoritarian rule. Syrians hope for better.
summary: Bashar al-Assad’s downfall evokes memories of uprisings in Egypt, Libya, Tunisia and Yemen, each of which brought civil war or authoritarian rule. Syrians hope for better.

title: Massacre in Haiti Ordered by Gang Leader Leaves Over 100 Dead, Rights Group Says

title: Ukraine’s Aggressive Draft Efforts Are Facing a Backlash
